availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p: City and County of New york SS. William Furniss, being &c appointed by the 28th of may 1861. a commissioner for the State of Kentucky residing in the State of new york being duly and solemnly sworn, says that he will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of his office as a commissioner for the State of Kentucky residing in the City of new york
Sworn and subscribed before me this 31st day of May 1861.
Comr. of the state of Kentucky for New York No 262 Broadway

figure.ab:
JOSEPH B. NONES
OF
Kentucky
FOR
NEW YORK
COMMISSIONER

body.p: Herewith witness a copy of my Signature and seal of office

William Furniss
Commissioner for Kentucky
residing in New york

figure.ab:
WM FURNISS, COMMISSIONER
FOR
KENTUCKY,
IN NEW YORK.

body.p:
New York
Oath
Comr of Deeds
Wm Furniss
